SchistoDB is an integrated genomic and functional genomic database for the genus Schistosoma, digenetic blood trematodes which cause human and animal diseases, named Schistosomiasis. The three main species infecting humans, Schistosoma japonicum, S. mansoni, S. haematobium, are collected in this SchistoDB database. SchistoDB integrates whole genome sequence and annotation along with experimental data and environmental isolate sequences provided by community researchers. The database includes supplemental bioinformatics analyses and a web interface for data-mining.

Schistosomes are atypical trematodes in that the adult stages have two sexes (dioecious) and are located in blood vessels of the definitive host. Most other trematodes are hermaphroditic and are found in the intestinal tract or in organs, such as the liver. The lifecycle of schistosomes includes two hosts: a definitive host (i.e. human) where the parasite undergoes sexual reproduction, and a single intermediate snail host where there are a number of asexual reproductive stages.

Geographic Distribution:

Schistosoma mansoni is found in parts of South America and the Caribbean, Africa, and the Middle East; S. haematobium in Africa and the Middle East; and S. japonicum in the Far East.

Annotated genomes:
  • Schistosoma mansoni
  • Schistosoma japonicum

Unannotated genomes:
  • Schistosoma haematobium

Much of the data in SchistoDB is provided by independent researchers. For a list of the data integrated into SchistoDB and the related publications see Data Sources. Please cite the authors/providers when you use their data.

• The EuPathDB Data Summary provides an overview of the content in EuPathDB across sites, all organisms and data types covered.
  • The EuPathDB Gene Metrics Table summarizes the number of genes for the organisms currently available in EuPathDB, by various datatypes.

There are several kinds of downloads available in a EuPathDB site:
  • Download files that we create at release time. The link to access these files is under the menu item "Downloads":"Data Files". These include fasta files for all available sequences, gff files with complete gene information, and other formats.
  • Download files with results generated by running searches. From a result page (after running a search) a user can access the "Download Results" link, to a new page where a few different download formats are offered. The file for download includes all IDs in the result. The user selects a format and, in some formats, the user may request additional information about each ID in the result: single valued attributes (e.g., exon count for a geneID) and multi-valued tables (e.g., set of EC numbers for a geneID).
  • Download files that have been uploaded by the community in our websites, available under "Downloads" or "Community".
  • Download EuPathDB publications, under the menu item "Downloads".

SchistoDB is a member of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and the University of Georgia in Athens, Georgia.

The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from SchistoDB, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data and SchistoDB. Please see Citing SchistoDB below.

When citing SchistoDB itself, please use:

SchistoDB: a Schistosoma mansoni genome resource. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D579-82. Zerlotini A, et al.

Much of the data in SchistoDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into SchistoDB and the related publications please see Data Sources.
